hackathon-description-text: SM Hacks is a 200-person hackathon that will gather the innovators of tomorrow into an amazing experience. It is San Mateo's first high school hackathon and will be held Saturday, Jan. 14 to Sunday, Jan. 15 at Informatica in Redwood City.
hackathon-rules:
Projects that don't follow the rules will be 
 from judging.
Rules:
-All code must be written during the event
-Stealing code is not permitted (Use of libraries and APIs is allowed)
-You must be at SM Hacks to submit a project for judging

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: 1x GoPro - HERO Session HD + Justinmind perpetual license + 1 year of Wolfram Development Platform + 1 year of Wolfram Mathematica Student Edition + 1 year of Wolfram|Alpha Pro, for each team member
1x Google Home + Justinmind perpetual license + 1 year of Wolfram Development Platform + 1 year of Wolfram Mathematica Student Edition + 1 year of Wolfram|Alpha Pro, for each team member.
1x Bose Soundlink Color Bluetooth Speaker + 1 year of Wolfram Development Platform + 1 year of Wolfram Mathematica Student Edition + 1 year of Wolfram|Alpha Pro, for each team member.
Google Chromecast + Amazon Echo Dot, one for each team member.
Partial Make School Academy scholarship, Particle.io Kit + Amazon Echo Dot, one for each team member.
1x Insignia Bluetooth Speaker for each team member.

hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=2100 Seaport Blvd, Redwood City, CA 94063, USA

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: Projects will be graded out of 5 based on their pitch to the judges.
Projects will be graded out of 5 based on the design of the UI.
Projects will be graded out of 5 based on the potential practical usage of their project.
Projects will be graded out of 5 based on originality/creativity.
Projects will be graded out of 5 based on technicality.

hackathon-location-address: 2100 Seaport Blvd, Redwood City, CA 94063, USA
hackathon-description-header: San Mateo's first high school hackathon!
